description: Squares arising in p=x^2+n, where p is the smallest prime of this form. Smallest q squares > 0 so that q+n is a prime.
formula: a(n)+n is the smallest prime with x^2+n form, where x^2=a(n).
example: n=24,a(24)=49 and 49+24=73 the first prime of x^2+24 form. For n=24 in 24+{1,4,9,16,25,36,49}={25,28,33,40,49,60,73) 49=p-n is the first prime generating square number.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 26 2001
